item.title: LoRA
item.description: Reference https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.09685 Hugging Face’s PEFT library Low-Rank Adaption The concept of rank appears in Linear Algebra. The rank of a matrix A refers to the number of linearly independent columns of A the dimension of the vector space spanned by its columns(independent columns) For the details, see the Linear Algebra posts. I didn’t know about PEFT(Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning) until I saw LoRA. It has several advantages. Cost efficient for training Less time consuming to train Can save only adapter model At first, I was perplexed by the concept of SVD(Singular Value Decomposition) since I was not and am not fully understand it.
